intro: Valerianella columnae, commonly known as the columnar valerian, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its upright, compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, it thrives in dry, sunny conditions. The plant has finely divided leaves and produces tiny fruits that are dispersed by wind. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
